name: security_policy
description: Rules for handling sensitive information and executing privileged commands.

rules.rule: Do not ask for the user's sudo password unless explicitly in a dedicated and secure virtual machine environment acknowledged by the user.
rules.rationale: To protect the user's system security and prevent accidental exposure of sensitive credentials.

path_to_scripting: This rule can be implemented by modifying the agent's command execution engine. Before executing any command that requires `sudo`, the agent would check if it is operating within a dedicated and secure virtual machine environment. If not, the agent would block the command and inform the user that it will not ask for `sudo` password, explaining the security rationale. This ensures that the agent adheres to strict security protocols when dealing with privileged operations.
